jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.description:
We are expanding our Customer Success organisation in London and are looking for an experienced Customer Success Manager in the London office. You will be responsible for driving customer adoption and success through strategic management and tactical execution across an assigned portfolio of accounts. The primary functions of this role are to ensure the building of strong, lasting and productive relationships both internally and externally. Additional responsibilities will include the ability to influence customer satisfaction; platform adoption; and retention and expansion of the Privitar business.
 
Privitar is a rapidly growing Data Privacy Enterprise Software company based in London, building software to enable the safe and ethical use of valuable data for analytics and machine learning. We work with large organizations worldwide in financial services, telecommunications, pharma, and government, enabling them to get the most out of data without compromising on privacy and security.

Backed by world-leading venture capital funds who’ve invested in companies like Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, Atlassian and Spotify, we have just completed a $40 million Series B funding round, and are in a phase of hyper growth.
 
Privitar is pioneering the new enterprise software category of Privacy Engineering to serve this emerging business need and address a social issue of growing importance. Our technology enables organizations to safely analyze and mine sensitive datasets while protecting an individual’s privacy.


Responsibilities
- Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned customers and act as an internal partner across Privitar, driving platform adoption and development/execution of ongoing account plans focused on value realization.
- Responsible for day-to-day internal and external action items in support of assigned customers, including platform training, enablement, driving effective meetings with proper planning and followup, and working with internal teams to resolve outstanding issues and escalate as needed.
- Understand the business value that Privitar provides to your customers by documenting additional use cases as needed.
- Leverage Privitar expertise and knowledge of the clients’ business to increase customer value, engagement, and platform adoption as well as to identify opportunities for account expansion.
- Drive relationships at various levels of the client organization; plan and oversee a multi-tiered client engagement strategy.
- Effectively prepare and deliver client presentations and QBRs, using data to craft a compelling story.
- Building Community – You will work with the customer’s Center of Excellence (CoE) as needed to foster a strong user community. Additional responsibilities could include participating in CoE formation discussions and contributing to customer’s strategic plans and goals for the successful creation of a CoE.
- Maintain a cadence of communicating with customers about their adoption trends, sentiment, and mining opportunities for deeper engagement.
- Work closely with the customer and Privitar support teams to manage expectations based on their support agreement with Privitar. When necessary, you will act as the point of escalation for customer support issues.
- Proactively identify any customer risks and collaborate with internal teams to remediate and ensure a successful renewal.
- Work closely with the Privitar Product team to ensure the Voice of the Customer is captured in the roadmap planning process.
- Gauge customers' levels of engagement with the company and provide feedback to the other teams regarding product and service improvements.
- Become a domain and industry expert.


Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree, required
- Minimum 5 years of Customer Success experience - experience with on-premise/hybrid cloud solutions preferred
- Proven ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
- Enjoys being part of a startup - excited at the challenge of building out best practices and figuring things out on the fly.
- Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to manage challenging situations and customers
- Experience managing relationships with Global 1000 clients at a variety of levels and backgrounds.
- Domain expertise in either financial services or healthcare/big pharma/health insurers preferred
- Knowledge of data privacy is a plus 
- Willingness to travel 15% of the time as needed

jobs.title: Director of Product Management
jobs.description:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a fast paced and growth oriented Product team working on an important commercial and social mission: helping companies unlock the analytical value of their data while ensuring that the privacy rights and expectations of individuals are respected.

We believe that a great product starts with a great team.  We are looking for a leader to work with the VP of Product and the existing team to help us design and build the Product team and culture of Privitar’s future. This is a player-coach role that will include People Management, Product Strategy, continuously improving our Product Delivery processes and acting as the Product Manager for an individual development team.

Privitar is a high growth, VC-backed, technology leader building data privacy software to enable analytics and machine learning. We work with large organisations worldwide in financial services, telecommunications, pharma and government, enabling them to get the most out of data without compromising on privacy and security.


Responsibilities
- Engage with Chief Data Officers, Chief Privacy Officers, Chief Compliance Officers, Data Architects and Data Engineers at our customers to understand market trends, data architecture patterns and customer use cases
- Work with the VP of Product, the Product team and other leaders across Privitar to continuously improve our Product Delivery process
- Lead, develop and hire a team of capable market-driven Product Managers 
- Work with the CTO, VP of Product and VP of Engineering on defining the team structures, KPIs and goals that will realize our Product Vision
- Work with Product Managers, Engineering and Customer Experience to develop key Product Strategy initiatives and bring them to the Product Council to drive investment and other strategic decisions
- Act as the Product Manager for one development team, developing the product roadmap and orchestrating product delivery end-to-end


Apply if this sounds like you!
- 10+ years of experience in Product Management, Product Development and/or Product Marketing, primarily in Enterprise B2B and SaaS
- 5+ years of experience managing Product Managers to a high standard
- Experience in growth and hyper-growth startupsExcellent written and verbal communication skills
- Experience with public speaking at town halls, webinars and conferences
- Ability to learn technical domains incredibly quickly
- Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
- Commercial, as well as technical, mindset
- Low ego, team player


Desirable experience and skills
- Experience working with Data Engineering and Data Analytics platforms and technologies (ex. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, NiFi)
- Experience with the service offerings of the major public cloud vendors (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure)
- MBA or experience in strategic planning


About Privitar
- Privitar is a dynamic data privacy start-up based in London, building software to enable the safe and ethical use of valuable data for analytics and machine learning. We work with the largest organizations worldwide in healthcare, financial services, telecommunications, pharma and government, enabling them to get the most out of data without compromising on privacy. Backed by world-leading venture capital funds who’ve invested in high-growth companies like Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, Atlassian and Spotify, we have just completed an $80 million Series C funding round, and are in a phase of hyper-growth. Privitar has offices in London, New York, Boston, Paris, Austin, Singapore and Warsaw.


Privitar does not accept unsolicited referrals or CVs from any source other than directly from candidates or approved agencies with written agreements in place and instructed on specified roles.

Unsolicited CVs received from any agency not engaged as outlined above will be considered a "free gift", and there will be no fees due should we choose to contact the candidate directly. Receipt of unsolicited CVs will in no way establish any prior claim to the candidate should they also be submitted by another agency. We consider this type of activity an attempt to lay claim to a given candidate and therefore entirely inappropriate. Any submission of unsolicited CVs to us will be deemed as full acceptance of these terms.
 
We only engage with agencies who are respectful of candidates, businesses and other agencies.  We abide by our agreements with them and maintain genuine, straight-forward and lasting relationships which generate the highest calibre candidates for our business.

jobs.title: Graduate Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Due to the current coronavirus situation we are now conducting all interviews entirely over video remotely. We are also able to onboard new starters remotely.

We are looking for multiple talented and passionate engineers who love to build products that have a tangible, positive impact on the world. We are opening a new Warsaw development office and are looking for talented graduates currently based in Poland to join us on permanent employment contracts.

Privitar is a dynamic, successful Data Privacy start-up headquartered in London, building software to enable the safe and ethical use of valuable data for analytics and machine learning. We work with large organisations worldwide in healthcare, financial services, telecommunications, pharma and government, enabling them to get the most out of data without compromising on privacy and security.

We are backed by world-leading venture capital funds who’ve invested in companies like Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, Atlassian and Spotify. We have recently completed a $80 million Series C funding round, and are in a phase of hyper growth.

Ideal candidates for this role learn and adapt quickly. You’ll combine state-of-the-art technologies with leading-edge algorithms to understand and tackle hard data security and data anonymisation problems. You will also be involved in performance, integrations and UI.

Our Engineering Culture

As engineers at Privitar, we are excited and engaged with the problems we are working on. We work together in small teams in a supportive way, developing our skills, learning from each other, and building on each other's ideas. We take a deep pride in the products we build and care about writing clear, well-tested code.

We have a positive, constructive and proactive approach and enjoy working to design and architect solutions, choose technologies, and constantly improve how we work as a team. We are not afraid to question something that might seem obvious or to give it a go and learn how to do things better.


About you
- An excellent academic record, achieving a Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science.
- Experience of coding, preferably in Java
- Demonstrable interest and knowledge of maths, big data, security or privacy.
- Good english communication skills
- You are keen to learn and contribute across both front and backend development.


Desirable
- Evidence of interest in Software Engineering outside of academia, e.g. personal projects or internships.
- Interest in Big Data technologies, e.g. Spark, Kafka, Nifi, Hadoop


Application Process
- A phone call with a member of our recruitment team to find out more about Privitar, and to get to know you
- One of the most interesting take home technical exercises you’ll see, designed by Privitar, unique to Privitar, relevant to Privitar 
- A face to face interview in Warsaw followed by final interviews in London.
- Offer

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.description:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join the product design team and contribute to the design of our product, strategy and execution at Privitar.

Privitar is a dynamic Data Privacy start-up based in London, building enterprise software to enable the safe and ethical use of valuable data for analytics and machine learning. We work with large organisations worldwide in healthcare, financial services, telecommunications, pharma and government, enabling them to get the most out of data without compromising on privacy. Backed by world-leading venture capital funds who’ve invested in high-growth companies like Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, Atlassian and Spotify, we have just completed a $80 million Series C funding round, and are in a phase of hyper-growth.

We believe that a great user experience is at the heart of any successful product. This is especially true in the emerging field of Data Privacy. This is an urgent, new problem in our data-driven society, and calls for a new approach to how data is used. We’re creating novel software to solve this problem, and our goal is to make it easy for enterprises to cut through the complexity and do the right thing by their customers, while continuing to innovate with data. 

As a Product Designer we want you to be a driving force in gathering insight into our users' needs, behaviours and intentions. You'll translate this into interface designs which make a subtle and complex problem easy to manage.  

You will be a key member of the product team, responsible for product design and user experience, working closely with customers, engineers and product managers throughout all stages of the product cycle.

We are looking for a product designer passionate about crafting elegant practical experiences and clear interfaces with pixel perfect precision that solve real world user problems in data protection and security. You understand the critical role design plays within a users experience and its relationship to business goals. You are goal oriented and think about the wider picture collaborating well with cross discipline team members. You have a strong grounding in user centered design process (UCD) showing huge empathy for the audience and continually seek feedback for improvement. You thrive in a fast but thorough environment ensuring quality and delivering value to users. 


What you'll do
- Help build Design culture at a hyper-growth tech company.
- Use design methods to understand and reframe the multiple problem spaces in data protection and security. 
- Work in cross functional teams partnering closely with engineering, product and business people to craft elegant and practical solutions to design challenges.
- Be autonomous, taking ownership of your work and be responsible for every detail throughout the discovery, concept, test to delivery lifecycle. 
- Rapidly produce pixel perfect UI and concepts, prototypes and low-fi sketches that progress and refine the experience of the Privitar platform.
- Evolve and maintain a design system approach and UCD process. 
- Execute research activities that deliver insights including and testing your own concepts.
- Introduce and iterate on product features based on user research and business goals.
- Contribute to building a strong and successful design team.


Who you are
- You have 5+ years of experience working as a Product Designer, UI and or UX designer. You’re a user focused, “swiss army knife” designer, capable of working across UX research, interaction design, information architecture, visual design.
- You have experience in a Product Design organisation and making trade-off decisions with engineers, prioritising work flows and validating concepts through growing with a product over multiple years.
- You’re rigorous in delivery of quality from conception to execution.
- You love building and working with design systems.
- You constantly seek user feedback to hone your design craft.
- You’re experienced in collaborating and delivering with engineering teams.
- You enjoy crafting and conducting user research activities and disseminating valuable insights across the company.
- You’re a clear communicator and constructive in review sessions for design, research and engineering.


Desirable
- Experience or interest in data visualisation or information visualisation.
- Experience of working in a B2B tech startup.
- Solid academic background with a degree specializing in design and or human-computer interaction.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Privitar is a rapidly growing VC-backed company based in London, building software to enable the safe and ethical use of valuable data for analytics and machine learning. We work with large organisations worldwide in financial services, telecommunications, pharma and government, enabling them to get the most out of data without compromising on privacy and security. 

Privitar is pioneering the new enterprise software category of Privacy Engineering to serve this emerging business need and address a social issue of growing importance.

We are looking for talented and passionate engineers who love to build great products and enjoy immersing themselves in hard data problems. You will be building innovative solutions using the latest technologies to solve one of the most important problems of the big data age.

Ideal candidates for this role learn and adapt quickly; you are comfortable with being dropped into challenging technical problems and being given the responsibility to solve them. You’ll combine state-of-the-art technologies with leading-edge algorithms to understand and tackle hard data security and data anonymisation problems.

You take a deep pride in the products you build and care about writing clear, well-tested code. You value working in a close-knit team with other talented people and seek both to learn from and help others. You have a positive, constructive and proactive approach and enjoy working with the team to design and architect solutions, choose technologies, implement, ensure quality and constantly improve how we work as a team.

You are excited about the variety and fast pace of a dynamic startup and relish the opportunity to make a sizable and meaningful contribution to the direction and success of a young company.

Requirements:

- Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or a Science or Engineering discipline
- High level of proficiency in Java including strong experience of multithreading or concurrent programming
- Experience building a software product, ideally over the full lifecycle from design to production and ongoing support and enhancement
- Strong experience of and commitment to automated testing
- Excellent communication skills (and the maturity to understand why this is vital)
- Ability to deliver results under pressure with rapidly evolving propositions, client demands and business needs

Desirable:

- Experience with distributed algorithms and re-factoring algorithms for a distributed computing model
- Exposure to Big Data technologies, for example: Hadoop, Spark, CassandraKnowledge of SQL and relational database technology
- Understanding of software security and threat models, and experience building secure applications
- Experience developing enterprise software products
- Experience leading a team and mentoring junior developers
- Knowledge of Python or another programming language
- Experience with Amazon AWS and other cloud platforms
